  • Element
com.sun.faces.annotation

Annotation Type Component


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface Component
    Annotation that identifies a class as being a JSF component class. The annotated type must be a public, non-abstract class. A minimal component annotation need contain no element values, e.g. 
        @Component
    public class MyComponent extends UIComponent {
        // ....
    }
    It is generally a good idea to provide, at a minimum, a suitable display name and component family, e.g. 
        @Component(
        displayName="My Component",
        family="org.example.Mine")
    public class MyComponent extends UIComponent {
        // ....
    }

    The javadoc-formatted comment found with the annotated class declaration is also considered part of this property's metadata. Typically, the first sentence of the comment will be used as the component's default short description.

    A component's properties should be annotated with the Property, annotation, and its events should be annotated with the Event annotation.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String displayName
      This component's display name, typically used at design-time.
      java.lang.String family
      This component's family.
      java.lang.String helpKey
      The name of a unique key used to associate help with this component at design-time.
      java.lang.String instanceName
      The basis of variable names generated for this component, typically at design-time.
      boolean isContainer
      Indicates whether this component may act as a container for other components.
      boolean isTag
      If true, this component is intended to be used only in Java code, and no JSP tag should be generated for it.
      java.lang.String propertiesHelpKey
      The name of a unique key used to associate help with this component at design-time.
      Component.ResizeConstraints[] resizeConstraints
      Controls the manner in which a component may be resized at design-time.
      java.lang.String shortDescription
      An optional short description of this component, typically used as a tool tip at design-time.
      java.lang.String tagName
      The name of the JSP tag that corresponds to this component.
      java.lang.String tagRendererType
      The renderer type for this component's tag.
      java.lang.String type
      This component's type, which acts as a unique identifier.

    • Element Detail

      • type

        public abstract java.lang.String type
        This component's type, which acts as a unique identifier. The value of type must be unique within the scope of the current compilation unit. If no value is supplied, the component class's fully qualifed name will be used.
        Default:
        ""

      • family

        public abstract java.lang.String family
        This component's family. The value should be the same as is returned by a call to UIComponent.getFamily(). If no value is supplied, defaults to the value of type().
        Default:
        ""

      • displayName

        @Localizable
public abstract java.lang.String displayName
        This component's display name, typically used at design-time. If no value is supplied, defaults to the component's simple class name.
        Default:
        ""

      • instanceName

        public abstract java.lang.String instanceName
        The basis of variable names generated for this component, typically at design-time. If no value is provided, defaults to the component's simple class name, with the first letter having been translated from upper to lower case.
        Default:
        ""

      • isTag

        public abstract boolean isTag
        If true, this component is intended to be used only in Java code, and no JSP tag should be generated for it.
        See Also:
        Property.isAttribute()
        Default:
        true

      • tagName

        public abstract java.lang.String tagName
        The name of the JSP tag that corresponds to this component. If no value is provided, the instanceName() will be used.

        Note: If this component does not correspond to a tag (isTag() is set to false), then providing a value for this element has no effect.

        Default:
        ""

      • tagRendererType

        public abstract java.lang.String tagRendererType
        The renderer type for this component's tag. The value specified must correspond to a renderer type specified for a renderer class in the current compilation unit (see Renderer.Renders.rendererType()). If not specified, and exactly one renderer type has been associated with this compononents family(), this value will default to that renderer type. If not specified, and more than one renderer type has been associated with this component's family(), the default value is undefined.

        Note: If this component does not correspond to a tag (isTag() is set to false), then providing a value for this element has no effect.

        Default:
        ""

      • shortDescription

        @Localizable
public abstract java.lang.String shortDescription
        An optional short description of this component, typically used as a tool tip at design-time. If no value is provided, the first sentence of the javadoc-formatted comment for this component's class definition will be used.
        Default:
        ""

      • isContainer

        public abstract boolean isContainer
        Indicates whether this component may act as a container for other components.
        Default:
        true

      • resizeConstraints

        public abstract Component.ResizeConstraints[] resizeConstraints
        Controls the manner in which a component may be resized at design-time.
        Default:
        com.sun.faces.annotation.Component.ResizeConstraints.ANY

      • helpKey

        public abstract java.lang.String helpKey
        The name of a unique key used to associate help with this component at design-time. If no key is provided, a suitable default will be generated.
        Default:
        ""

      • propertiesHelpKey

        public abstract java.lang.String propertiesHelpKey
        The name of a unique key used to associate help with this component at design-time. If no key is provided, a suitable default will be generated.
        Default:
        ""
